rites.title: Opening Ceremony
rites.description: The meeting begins with the recitation of the group pledge, followed by a moment of silence and the opening prayer.
steps: PRESIDENT: Brothers, this is a general (special) meeting of the Cadet Commandery No.832. Brother, Messenger (who rises) Is this hall properly guarded?
MESSENGER: (After inspection) Yes! It is OR (No! It is not)
PRESIDENT: Are all present, members of the Cadet Commandery? (Messenger inspects identity cards) Are the Officers present in their proper places?
MESSENGER: (after inspection) Yes, they are OR I find ………. absent (in the absence of an Officer)

Opening Hymn  (Bind us together) - Prayer One Our Father, One Hail Mary, One Glory be to the Father, Knights of St. John Prayer, Cadet Protection Prayer  refer to I.D. card The Pledge - Cadets sit after pledge
REFLECTION: Begin with a song, Reading from the Bible and explanation or comments A song

PRESIDENT: Brother Secretary, read the minutes of the previous meeting (After the reading of the minutes) Brothers, you’ve heard the minutes of the last meeting, is there any correction or omission?If not, would someone move for the acceptance of the minutes.
A brother stands and says, “In the absence of any (other) corrections or omissions, I (name) move that the minutes be accepted.
PRESIDENT: Any seconder? A brother stands and says, I, (name) second the motion Now we shall deal with matters arising out of the minutes

Admission of new members (if any) Reports from committees (if any) Correspondence – After reading all letters, the President will ask a Brother to move a motion for the acceptance of the letters (or reject any if necessary) New business for the day/Announcements Roll Call Finance (dues and monies received for the day) For the good of the Cadet Order

PRESIDENT: Is there any further business before this Cadet Commandery? Here, if there are any other matters to be discussed or forgotten, a brother would raise his hand and say it but if there is none, the President continues): Brothers, when we leave this room, know that the eyes of the public are on you, you  must therefore behave yourselves in a manner which will reflect the good image of our Order. Is that right? (all brothers answer, “Yes! Worthy President)
PRESIDENT: CLOSING PRAYER: One Our Father, One Hail Mary, One Glory be to the Father, Knights of St. John Prayer CLOSING-HYMN
PRESIDENT: I declare this meeting of the Cadet Commandery closed. Good day, Brothers
